title: 1D kinematics - average acceleration of a car

content.question: A car is driving east on a straight, level road with a speed of <math alttext="20 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> when it begins to accelerate eastward at a constant rate. After <math alttext="5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> the car has a speed of <math alttext="40 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> to the east. The acceleration of the car during the <math alttext="5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> time interval is

choices.label: <math alttext="4 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="8 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="20 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="30 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
